question: What is a hackathon?
answer: A hackathon is an event where individuals or teams work on technical projects in a short period of time (24-36 hours). With the help of workshops and mentors you can build an app, a website, a robot—the possibilities are endless!

question: Who can participate?
answer: This hackathon is for people of marginalized genders who are 14 years or older. Men are welcome to mentor, volunteer, judge, or participate as sponsors.

question: Who are individuals of marginalized genders?
answer: Our definition includes transgender women, cisgender women, transgender men, non-binary individuals, and all gender identities which have been systematically oppressed by those in power throughout history.

question: Is there a cost to attend?
answer: Nope! TechTogether Boston is free to attend :)

question: How will I participate in TechTogether Boston?
answer: This year TechTogether Boston will run virtually and use platforms like Discord and Zoom. We will provide more details on how to participate as we get closer to the date.

question: What skills do I need to participate?
answer: Our hackathons are very beginner friendly! We have intro workshops tailored to first-time hackers and a unique high school program to help assimilate all our hackers! If you want to fine tune your skills, here are some fun Python projects you can work on.

question: How will teams work?
answer: Teams can consist of 2-4 hackers. You can form a team before the hackathon, and there will be Team Formation events on Friday and Saturday to meet other hackers. We highly encourage that advanced hackers bring on beginner hackers to mentor throughout the event.

question: How do I find a team to join?
answer: While you have the option to work alone, if you want to submit your project you must work with at least one other person. Don’t worry if you don’t have a team—you’ll have plenty of opportunities to find one virtually! TechTogether will be hosting a variety of team formation activities throughout the first day, and we will also have a Discord channel dedicated to team formation leading up to and during the event.

question: Will there be swag and prizes?
answer: TechTogether Boston is donating to local nonprofits in the form of swag this year, but there will be prizes!

question: Where do I submit my solution/project?
answer: Your project will be submitted through Devpost. Click on the Submit Project button at the top of the site to access the Devpost. Your submission must include a video (no longer than 2 minutes) that showcases your project, a basic description of your project, and the challenge(s) for which you want your project to be considered.

question: Where do I go to attend a session?
answer: All workshops, activities and events will be taking place via Zoom. Meetings links will be shared via Discord.

question: How to I find a mentor for help?
answer: Mentoring will all be done through Discord. To request a mentor, fill out the form on the Discord channel  and a mentor will be in touch with you as soon as they are available!

question: I did not get an invite to join Discord. How do I get the invite?
answer: Register on Eventbrite and fill out our check-in form. Once everything is filled out, an invite to join the Disocrd will be sent to your email. Make sure to check your spam folder for the invitations.

question: What is the project submission deadline?
answer: Make sure to check the event schedule to stay up to date on important hackathon deadlines and everything you need to know about what's going on throughout the weekend! Announcements and reminders will also be broadcasted on the Discord server in case you forget.

question: Where can I access workshop recordings?
answer: Workshop recordings will be available via a Google Drive folder and shared with participants following the completion of the event. So don't worry if you happen to miss one of this weekend's workshops because we got you covered!

question: I have more questions!
answer: We’re happy to answer! Please DM us on Instagram or Twitter, or contact us at info.boston@techtogether.io for any questions/concerns.
